<p>Hi, I'm Lily! I'm a Biostatistics PhD candidate at Johns Hopkins Bloomberg School of Public Health.
My research interests lie at the intersection of statistics, physical activity,
data from wearable devices, and human performance + sports science. 

I was born and raised in Orono, Maine. I got my undergraduate degree in Statistics at [Harvard](https://www.harvard.edu/) and my Master's degree in Biostatistics at the [Harvard School of Public Health](https://www.hsph.harvard.edu/). At Harvard, I competed on and captained the [Nordic ski team](https://gocrimson.com/sports/alpine-skiing/roster/lily-koffman/8198).

Previously, I worked for US Ski and Snowboard as a high
performance intern and [Women in Sports Technology (WiST) Fellow](https://www.womeninsportstech.org/fellowship-alumni). My 
research projects included visualizing force plate output, using machine
learning to predicting performance from training data, and modeling
medal probabilities to inform team selection criteria. 

In my free time, I enjoy running, skiing, cycling, camping, and baking sourdough. 
</p>
